required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI-based Approaches for Multi-omics Model to Early Predict Pathologic Response to Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An MRI-based, Multi-omics Model for Early Prediction of Pathologic Response After the First Cycle of Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research is to evaluate the accuracy of a multi-omics model based on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) in predicting pathologic response after the first cycle of neoadjuvant chemotherapy given to patients with locally advanced breast cancer, thus allowing early chemotherapy regimen modification to increase number of patients achieving pathological complete response or save patients from toxic effects of ineffective chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of the MRI-based multi-omics model in evaluating tumor response
primary_outcome.description: defined as the model's capability of accurately identifying patients who will achieve pathological complete response

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of the MRI-based multi-omics model in evaluating tumor response
secondary_outcome.description: defined as the model's capability of accurately identifying patients who will not achieve pathological complete response

study_pop.textblock: Selection of patients diagnosed with breast cancer and treated with neo-adjuvant chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥18 years.
- Histologically confirmed invasive breast carcinoma
- Clinical stage II-III at presentation
- Scheduled for neoadjuvant chemotherapy
- Signed informed consent
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have received any prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy or endocrine therapy for their current breast cancer.
- Patients with any general contraindication to MRI.
- Patient with breast cancer who are not eligible for NAC (pregnant patients, multicentric breast cancer, metastatic breast cancer).
